page.title: 04Housing in West End,Stoke
page.content: The Villas is a private road of houses. The houses are very large because the rich people who owned factories used to live there.The Villas are just across the road from the school.The road through the Villas is not tarmaced.It is dusty,stony and bumpy.In the middle of the road there is a gas lamp.A man tied himself to it because he did not want it to be removed. The houses are Italian style.They have stone walls,stone pillars,arches, large gates and lovely gardens. Stokeville,as the Villas was called, was unique to the area.They were residences for the middle classes only. Lynam,the architect,had the idea for the Villas from villa style houses he had seen on his travels between Stoke and London.
